title: French support for preschool children’s lunch programme
author: Author not found
Content: Minister of State for Women, Children Affairs and Social Empowerment, Geeta Kumarasinghe met the French Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Jean-Francois PACTET on 18 April to get French Government support for the preschool children’s lunch programme. The French Ambassador expressed his agreement to provide a direct contribution to the lunch programme for pre-school children organised by UNICEF. In addition, it was decided to hold a meeting between the French Ambassador and President Ranil Wickremesinghe. Completion of work at the Moneragala Child Care Centre, printing of a sticker with telephone numbers (1929, 1938) introduced to report child and women abuse, especially women’s wages being lower compared to men working in plantations and gender equality. The Minister also informed the French Ambassador about the National Policy on Women Empowerment. (NV)

title: SriLankan, LRC, UGC to go before COPE
author: Author not found
Content: Several institutions, including SriLankan Airlines, Land Reforms Commission(LRC), and the University Grants Commission (UGC), are scheduled to be summoned before the Committee on Public Enterprises(COPE) during the coming week. Accordingly, Sri Lanka Export Credit Insurance Corporation has been summoned on25 April. On 26 April the Land Reforms Commission has been summoned to review the progress of implementing directives issued at the COPE meeting held on 21 October 2022. Furthermore, SriLankan Airlines has been called before COPE on 27 April and the UGC is scheduled be present on 28 April. The Vocational Training Authority of Sri Lanka is scheduled to be called on 9 May to review the progress of implementing directives issued at the COPE meeting held on 23 March.

title: Senior Citizenscelebrate New Year
author: Author not found
Content: An ‘Avurudu Uthsawaya’ organised by senior citizens’ rural organisations in the Moratuwa Divisional Secretariat Division will be held on 22 April from 9.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. at Buddhist Centre Hall premises, Moratuwa. About 800 senior citizens, from 60 to 100 years, will participate in the occasion. According to the organising committee Chairman Steven Makalandawa, new year games, singing competition and several other events will be held.

title: Veteran actor on life support due to ‘surgical mishap’
author: Author not found
Content: The Association of Health Professionals (AHP) called for an urgent clinical investigation into claims made by veteran Film Director Somaratne Dissanayake that a surgery had posed a threat to a veteran actor’s life, requiring him to be placed on a ventilator for a prolonged period at the National Hospital, Colombo. AHP President Ravi Kumudesh yesterday (19) explained that whatever the answer his fans craved to the question of whether this veteran actor would be able to regain his former strength, the medical answer would be “no.” He said although individuals could harbour theistic, miraculous and strange beliefs, medical science must prevail inside a hospital. Therefore, advice should be sought medically in this regard. “What some people believe to be the actor’s life is dependent on science and technical equipment,” he said. “The most important factor was that the ventilator which has been allocated for him as a patient for a lengthy period may have been used to save many more lives. Instead, those lives have been put at risk to save the life of the veteran actor. It would be worthwhile if his life could be saved. But, no one has the right to offer another life for that,” Kumudesh said. He added that all those who wanted to safeguard the veteran actor’s life could help by making this facility artificially at his home or in a special place. “Or else, if hearts soften the way they do for the veteran actor such a facility could be built for those who are put at risk by this prolonged wait for the patient on the ventilator to return to normal,” he added. (DJ)

title: India becomes world’s most populous nation
author: Author not found
Content: India has now crossed China to become the most populous country in the world, according to the United Nations Data. The UN world population dashboard stated that India now has 1428.6 million people while China’s population stands at 1425.7 million.This is for the first time that India has topped the United Nations’ list of most populated countries, ever since the UN began collecting population data in 1950. The year before, China’s population shrank for the first time since 1960. In 2016, Beijing ended its strict ‘one-child policy,’ imposed in the 1980s amid overpopulation fears, and began letting couples have three children in 2021. China faces an impending demographic decline, as its workforce ages and fertility rates decrease. Meanwhile, the United States is in the third position with an estimated population of 340 million. India has not performed a census since 2011, hence there are no fresh official statistics available on its population size. The once-in-a-decade census in India was scheduled to take place in 2021 but was postponed because of the coronavirus outbreak. The global population is expected to hit 8.045 billion by mid-2023, according to UN data.

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: HRCSL recommends Police to adequately compensate family
author: Author not found
Content: The Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka (HRCSL) has recommended that the Inspector General of Police (IGP) and Sri Lanka Police should pay adequate compensation to wife and two children of Chaminda Lakshan, who was killed as a result of the Police opening fire on a public protest in Rambukkana on 19 April last year. Lakshan who was the sole breadwinner of his family was killed during a protest to demand for fuel. Similarly, the HRCSL has suggested that the Police Department should also pay adequate compensation to each of the victims, who had sustained injuries following the excessive use of force by its officers, on the said date, during the protest. The aforementioned recommendations are contained in the final report compiled by the HRCSL, which probed the controversial incident at Rambukkana in 2022. The HRCSL, in its recommendations, has further advised the IGP to conduct an in-depth probe into the incident via the CCTV footage taken from the venue, with the use of evidence and special discoveries, to identify the Police officer directly responsible for the death of Chaminda Lakshan and to submit a report to the Attorney General to institute action against other officers behind the incident. By Amith Maduranga Gamage

title: Rs 45B withdrawn from BOC ATMs alone during Avurudu week– Manusha
author: Author not found
Content: The people have withdrawn Rs 45 billion from Bank of Ceylon (BOC) ATMs alone during Sinhala and Tamil New Year festive week, Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment Manusha Nanayakkara said. Addressing the media, yesterday (19) he said while he and likeminded people clamored for the well-being of the people and to change the system, some people today are clamoring, because they are worried, they will no longer be able to engage in petty politics that deceive the people. Nanayakkara said people who are now shouting all over the country and the world are people who are upset because the country has been revived from the abysmal situation which it was a few months back. “But why are some people worried now? Foreign reserves had fallen below USD 50 million. We only had reserves in gold. As of today, we have been able to increase the foreign reserves to USD 2.3 billion. The expatriate workers as well as our exporters helped to increase the foreign reserves. Even though expatriate workers were told by some not to send money, expatriate workers sent USD 580 million last month alone. During these months, billions in money was sent to the country. People were able to buy medicine. The children of our country were able to go back to school. After three years, we were able to celebrate the New Year. People went back to villages. Tourists came back to Sri Lanka. The New Year celebrations started again. People withdrew Rs 45 billion from the Bank of Ceylon ATM’s alone during the Avurudu week,” he claimed. Nanayakkara said the country has now been saved from bankruptcy. “We got enough fuel for the New Year. On 2 January, diesel was reduced by Rs 15 and kerosene by Rs 10. On March 29, petrol was reduced by Rs 60, diesel by Rs 80 and kerosene by Rs 10 again. The price of fuel was reduced to match the price of fuel in the world market. Gas price was reduced by Rs 1000. We got assistance from the International Monetary Fund (IMF). The investors have now started coming to the country again. The Asian Development Bank (ADB) and the Paris Club are discussing how to help Sri Lanka. Our teams are negotiating with the World Bank team to get a lot of concessions. Development projects are being started in our country,” he said. He added that the President Ranil Wickremesinghe is changing the country by putting aside party politics. “Taxes are taken from those who should be taxed. Taxes are levied only on those who earn more than Rs 100,000. Only a few people are taxed in this country. In spite of that, they say that we are responsible for losing billions to the country by stopping work at the port. They are trying to destabilise the country. Will the wages of those who went on street protests, be cut?  Slogans disappear when the country is normalised. When all these things are restored, a situation has been created where it is impossible to shout on the streets,” he added. He further claimed that some parties, when schools are opened and education is restored, are trying to create unrest in the country by stopping the evaluation of examination answer scripts. They are trying to create unrest within universities. They are trying to see whether it is possible to create youth unrest like in 88-89. They are always trying to spread hatred and unrest. They are trying to create a crisis again, he alleged. By Nabiya Vaffoor

title: Teacher transfers continue as usual
author: Author not found
Content: The principals of a few leading schools in Colombo including Royal College had complained to the President in writing that though the President has dissolved the Teacher Transfer Board (TTB), the transfers are continuing unimpeded. The President dissolved the TTB due to allegations that the process was being carried out at the whims and fancies of the teacher trade unions. The principals of these schools have complained to the President that the entire teacher transfer system is being controlled by a few trade unions functioning under the influence of a few political parties with vested interests.  They have urged him to look into the issue forthwith and resolve it expeditiously. Education Minister Susil Premajayantha recently said in Parliament that although the TTB was dissolved, the transfers except for A/L teachers would continue. By Amith Maduranga Gamage

title: President issues ultimatum to teachers
author: Author not found
Content: President Ranil Wickremesinghe issued an ultimatum to teachers and vowed to declare education as an essential service, under Emergency Regulations, if they are not available for Advanced Level paper-marking by next week. According to the President’s Media Division (PMD), the President, who met Education Ministry officials yesterday afternoon (19) also insisted that he will not allow the education of children to be taken hostage by teachers.  If teachers are not available for marking A/L exam papers by next week, he said, he will initiate legal action against those who fail to fulfil their responsibilities. A/L paper-marking had to be postponed indefinitely owing to the lack of interest of teachers and university lecturers. There weren’t enough applications from teachers as a result of the low allowance. University lecturers have presented several demands including amendments to APIT tax scheme.

title: IMF does not get involved in debt restructuring negotiations
author: Author not found
Content: Sri Lanka is expected to outline a strategy or blueprint and engage with its creditors later this month, and that will provide a basis for engaging with creditors on the debt restructuring, Krishna Srinivasan, Director of the Asia and Pacific Department, International Monetary Fund (IMF) said during a media briefing recently. Ceylon Today inquired as to what the debt restructuring for Sri Lanka’s creditors entails and what options are available to them, to which Srinivasan said the decision on how the restructuring happens in terms of providing debt relief, that’s something which varies. “It has been negotiated between Sri Lanka and its creditors. Now, it could take the form of principle haircuts, an extension of maturity and interest rate reduction. So, what form it takes has been negotiated between Sri Lanka and its creditors, and we don’t get involved in that.” On debt relief, he said, “I think the way we have in the programme right now, again, the targets we have in the programme are aimed at restoring debt sustainability and balance of payment pressures even after the programme expires. So, debt relief is expected to contribute about USD 17 billion to close the BOP financing gap from 2023 to 2027, which is an overall gap is about USD 24 billion. So, the remainder of this gap is covered by financing from International Financial Institutions (IFI) and so on. At the press brief, he also noted that the Asian economies must also prioritise policy incentives that foster long-term growth. Structural reforms are needed to boost innovation and digitalisation. Actually, the green transition – energy transition, reduces its fragmentation and then shows full security, he added. By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan

title: Cardinal cannot prosecute me– Sirisena
author: Author not found
Content: Former President Maithripala Sirisena stressed yesterday (19) that Colombo Archbishop Malcolm Cardinal Ranjith does not hold any judicial power with regard to the 2019 Easter Sunday terror attacks, and only the Judiciary or the Chief Justice has the authority to implement the law against him. Sirisena said this when visiting the Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy yesterday (19). Responding to a journalist on Cardinal Ranjith’s recent statement that strict legal action must be taken against Sirisena if the latter fails to pay compensation to Easter Sunday victims, the former President said Cardinal Ranjith is not the Chief Justice and only the Court can decide on such action. When queried whether he would contest the next Presidential Election, Sirisena said he is not aware which election will come first and a decision must be taken on elections by the Election Commission (EC). “We will accept the EC’s decisions on elections,” he added. Speaking further, the former President said the SLFP’s May Day rally will be held in Kandy. By Methmalie Dissanayake

title: Dappula’s lawyer files objections before TID
author: Author not found
Content: A seven-page objection was filed on behalf of former Attorney General Dappula de Livera before the Terrorism Investigation Department (TID) yesterday (19), pertaining to a statement made by him in regard to the Easter Sunday attacks. Livera was summoned by the TID to record a statement yesterday (19) in connection with the said statement. However he did not turn up and the objection was filed on his behalf by Attorney-at-Law Dimithri Abeysekera ‘’When Dappula de Livera was the Attorney General, he handed over a 130-page letter containing instructions to the Inspector General of Police, thereby Police and the current Attorney General should be questioned as to whether any measures have been taken in connection with the said instructions, ‘’ Abeysekera said. He added there is no need to record statements from the former Attorney General when the current Attorney General has filed indictments. Minister of Justice, Prisons Affairs and Constitutional Reforms Dr. Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe on Tuesday (18) said the Attorney General has been informed to record a statement from de Livera on the same. “The former Attorney General, before his retirement, made a statement that there was a conspiracy pertaining to the Easter Sunday attacks,” Rajapakshe said adding that there is an issue about such statement. Rajapakshe added that de Livera, as the Attorney General at the time, had the power to call for further investigations if he was dissatisfied with the investigations and he also had the power to report to the Magistrate’s Court seeking to order Police to conduct investigations. BY Faadhila Thassim

title: Security tightened in Akurana following threat to mosques
author: Author not found
Content: Security was beefed up in Akurana, Kandy yesterday (19), following a phone call received by the Police emergency hotline 119, on the previous night, about a possible attack to mosques during prayers in the holy month of Ramadan. Following the unverified information, the residents in the town also started checking devotees who came to the mosques. Police Spokesman SSP Nihal Thalduwa said special Police teams were sent to Akurana following the situation. Those teams will remain in the town until the situation is resolved. Speaking to Ceylon Today, SSP Kandy C. K. Ratnayake said that an anonymous call had been received claiming that bomb explosions could take place targeting Mosques and other public places in Akurana, Kandy. According to him, upon receiving the call they had conveyed the information to relevant Police Divisions while taking measures to relay the details to those at Mosques and public places. The SSP stressed that the public should not be either unduly concerned or even run into a panic situation over the news as the Police and the Army had already taken necessary precautions to prevent any explosion from taking place. Ratnayake opined that the State Intelligence Service (SIS) has already commenced an immediate probe into the anonymous call received by the Police and assured that the situation has been brought under control. The Alawathugoda Police has also informed the public that they should exhibit extra vigilance in their day-to-day activities and has advised them to inform the Police pronto if they notice any unidentified people roaming around the Akurana town and its environs. Meanwhile, Army Spokesman Brigadier Ravi Herath said that the Police sought their help regards the anonymous call received about an attempt to explode bombs in Akurana. He mentioned that a few Army teams had been deployed to conduct probes and affirmed that they were standing by to support the Police in case of an emergency. He noted that both, the Police and the Army had already intensified security in Akurana and added that the public should go about their day-to-day activity without fear. By Mithun Jayawardena

title: Off-season Sri Pada trekking curtailed
author: Author not found
Content: The Sri Pada Vandana Pooja Committee, which convened on 18 April, decided to curtail off-season pilgrimages to the Sacred Site with immediate effect owing to several issues. The Committee met under the aegis of the Chief Incumbent of Sri Pada, Ven. Bengamuwe Dhammadinna Thera, at the Ratnapura District Secretariat. Airing his views on the occasion, Governor of Sabaragamuwa Province Tikiri Kobbekaduwa said due to devotees trekking the Sri Pada Holy Site during the off season many issues have cropped up. He remarked that certain youths had shown a tendency to trek the Sri Pada Site to exhibit their heroism and bravery during the off-season. Ven. Bengamuwe Dhammadinna Thera mentioned that the Sri Pada season has    been officially sanctioned annually, from the dawn of the Unduwap Poya Day in December and ending with the Vesak Poya Day in May. He added that the period from May up to December has been designated as the off season for trekking the Sacred Site. Ven. Thera said as the weather conditions are unsuitable for devotees to visit the sacred site, the period from May to December has been classified as the off season during the past few decades. He further observed that many facilities for devotees such as electricity, water, public security, medical services and food supply is in short supply during the off season. Ven. Thera said it is suitable for give permission for trekking Sri Pada during off season only for essential activities such as education related trips, tours by foreigners and other traditional and cultural activities such as ‘baara haara’ under a special monitoring mechanism.

title: Eye Hospital suspends routine surgeries
author: Author not found
Content: Doctors called for yet another departmental inquiry when routine surgeries at the National Eye Hospital, Colombo came to a halt yesterday (19) following the detection of post-surgical infections in several cases. Media Committee Member of the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA), Dr. Chamil Wijesinghe yesterday (19) said however that emergency surgeries were being carried out using another theatre. However, routine surgeries have been halted while they were to tentatively recommence next week. He called for a departmental inquiry into the issue while noting that investigations should be conducted to assess as to whether the infection was being caused by a drug or an instrument being used. Dr. Wijesinghe said the findings of the investigation should be revealed to the public or else it would have a severe impact on its trust in the surgical procedure at the National Eye Hospital (NEH), Colombo. He said the Health Ministry and the Department of Health should also ensure that such incidents do not recur. If the issue is due to a medicinal drug that is being used then measures should be taken to withdraw that particular batch from State hospitals, he said. He further said it was one reason that the country needed a National Pharmaceutical Quality Control Laboratory (NPQCL).    Meanwhile, the President of the Association of Health Professionals (AHP) said operations have been allegedly halted indefinitely at the National Eye Hospital. He lamented that with no starting date for the halted surgeries there is no one to be held accountable for the patients awaiting eye surgery. “What is the need for a Health Ministry if this was the attitude,” Ravi Kumudesh queried. He added that the closure of State-run hospitals, allowing wards to shut down, turning away patients without medicine, and asking them to proceed as they can without carrying out their medical tests in the free health service, has become an unusual situation that is common in State hospitals. He said patients had been informed that surgeries will not be performed at the NEH since 19 April while during the past number of weeks, not even 50 per cent of the surgeries that should have been performed were done. He alleged that certain phases of surgeries have been pushed to the private sector while the remaining surgeries have been put on the waiting list. “Presently all surgeries have been suspended, placing patients’ lives at stake,” Kumudesh lamented, demanding as to where those who had shed crocodile tears for patients during health strikes are at present. He warned that the waiting list may even exceed the life of patients on it if no measures are taken to urgently rectify this situation and recommence eye surgeries.  By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: Episcopal Ordination on Saturday at St. Mary’s Cathedral in Badulla
author: Author not found
Content: Rev.Fr. Echchampulle Arachchige Jude Nishanta Silva, the new Bishop named for the Badulla Catholic Diocese in the Uva Province by the Head of the Universal Church, His Holiness  Pope Francis will be consecrated and installed, on Saturday, April 22 at 10.00 a.m. in the presence of the Members of the Catholic Bishop Conference of Sri Lanka. The incumbent Bishop of the Badulla Diocese His Lordship Rt. Rev. Dr. J. Winston S. Fernando SSS will preside at the Episcopal Ordination (Consecration) ceremony at St. Mary’s Cathedral Badulla.   Fr. Nishantha Silva was named as the New Bishop by the Holy See on 30 January 2023  accepting the letter sent by the incumbent Bishop, His Lordship Rt. Rev. Dr. J. Winston S. Fernando SSS, informed the Holy See that he retires from the post in accordance with the expressed stipulation of the Canon Law having reached age 75, the age of retirement.     Rev.Fr. Jude Nishantha is the very first Diocesan Priest from Badulla, to wear the ‘Red Hat’ after being elevated as the fourth Bishop of the 52-year-long history, after the creation of the Badulla Diocese, in the Uva Province. Coincidently the new Bishop named Fr. Nishantha will celebrate his 53rd birthday on 5 May this year. When the news was released by Archbishop Most. Rev. Dr. Brian Udaiguwe, the Apostolic Nuncio from his Colombo Office, that the Holy See has named Fr. Jude Nishantha Silva as the New Bishop, the Badulla Grand Jumma Masjid and the Muslim community had been the first to display a banner, congratulating and welcoming Him, a sign of asserting religious harmony existing in the District. The Bishop-named Rev. Fr. Jude Nishantha Silva, was a former Director of the Uva Socio-Economic and Community Development Centre (USCOD) and the Parish Priest of the Cathedral dedicated to the Blessed Virgin Mary, the Mother of Jesus Christ the Divine Saviour whose Solemn Resurrection, back to life,   the Catholic Church celebrated on Easter Sunday. Fr. Jude Nishantha is the youngest and sixth child in his family. Born on  5 May 1970 to Joseph Silva and G. Maria Fernando of Katukurunda, Kalutara, he had his primary education at the Roman Catholic School in Katukurunda and secondary education at St. Joseph College, Maradana. In 1992,  at 22 he joined St. Aloysius Minor  Seminary, Borella, and then joined Hawaden, St. Eymard  Seminary, Haputale after completing his  HSC to dedicate his life to serving in the Vineyard of the Lord. From there he was sent to pursue his vocation to ‘Dhaham Sevana’- Mont Eden, Palathota, Kalutara in 1994, and in the same year he proceeded to the National Seminary of Our Lady of Sri Lanka, to continue with his priestly studies. He was ordained as a priest on 2 October, 2001, at St. Philip Neri Church, Katukurunda by His Lordship Rt. Rev. Dr. J. Winston S. Fernando SSS, Bishop of Badulla. Fr. Jude served as an Assistant Parish Priest for some time and went to St. Luke’s Church Pallimunai, Mannar to enhance his knowledge of the Tamil language. On his return to Badulla, he was appointed rector of the minor seminary. In 2007, he was sent to the Pontifical Urban University in Rome to follow a degree course on Church Law. Having completed his course, he was back in the country and was sent to the Chilaw Diocesan Matrimonial Tribune to further study and acquire experience. He also served as the Parish Priest of St. Mary’s Cathedral, Badulla, and as Director of Uva Socio-Economic and Community Development Centre USCOD and CARITAS.  With the setting up of the Badulla Diocese, the then Bishop of Kandy Rt. Rev. Dr. Leo Nanayakkara OSB (a Member of the Sylvestro Benedictine Congregation)  moved as the pioneering Bishop of the New Diocese and was followed by Colombo Diocese Auxiliary Bishop  Rt. Rev. Dr. Edmund Joseph Fernando OMI (a Member of the Congregation of the Oblates of Mary Immaculate) and with his retirement Rev. Fr. J. Winston S. Fernando SSS ( a Member of Blessed Sacrament Community) was consecrated as the third Bishop of Badulla. This is the first time a Diocesan Priest from the Badulla Catholic Diocese assumes the post with the retirement of Rt. Rev. Dr. Winston Fernando SSS, who served for 26 years as the Bishop of the Diocese and in 2022, he celebrated the golden jubilee of the Badulla Diocese. (E.Weeraperuma)

title: Terumo, Hemas donate hypodermic syringes to Lady Ridgeway Hospital
author: Author not found
Content: Terumo Corporation and its distributor Hemas Surgicals & Diagnostics (Pvt) Ltd commemorate Terumo’s 30 years in Sri Lanka by donating hypodermic syringes to the Lady Ridgeway Hospital for Children, as a first step of a series of donations planned for hospitals across the island. The donation is part of Hemas’ commitment to make healthy living accessible to communities across Sri Lanka, a spokesman said. Hemas believes that every family deserves a better tomorrow and is committed to providing healthcare products and services to all areas of Sri Lanka without any inequalities. The company’s partnership with Terumo allows them to fulfil their social responsibility to the general public through their own products and services, he added. Jude Fernando, MD Hemas Surgicals & Diagnostics said, “As Hemas celebrates its 30th anniversary as exclusive distributor for Terumo Corporation Japan, we are proud to mark this milestone by making as series of donations to hospitals in Sri Lanka, in collaboration with Terumo. In addition to making a positive impact on the healthcare industry in Sri Lanka, we are also hopeful that this initiative will be well received by everyone who are facing a medicine shortage at present. We extend our sincere gratitude to Terumo Singapore Pte. Ltd. for generously providing the hypodermic syringes for these donations, which will support patients across the country.” Speaking on this initiative, Delan Silva, Senior Business Manager, Terumo said, “Terumo is a global leader in medical technology and has been committed to ‘Contributing to Society through Healthcare’ for 100 years. Based in Tokyo and operating globally to provide innovative medical solutions in more than 160 countries and regions, the company started as a Japanese thermometer manufacturer and has been supporting healthcare ever since. Now, its extensive business portfolio ranges from vascular intervention and cardio-surgical solutions, blood transfusion and cell therapy technology, to medical products essential for daily clinical practice. Terumo will further strive to be of value to patients, medical professionals, and society at large,” The donation to Lady Ridgeway Hospital for Children demonstrates Hemas’ and Terumo’s commitment to contribute to society through healthcare. The project highlights Hemas’ dedication to strive to be of value to communities across the country. Hemas remains committed to fulfilling its social responsibility and providing high-quality healthcare products and services to all areas of Sri Lanka, the spokesman further said.

title: Night driving on Marine Drive a nightmare!
author: Author not found
Content: Night time driving along Marine Drive is a nightmare with the two ends of the road coming under the purview of the CMC are in total darkness. The lamp-posts are mere decorations and are still  not installed. The stretch from the Colpetty railway station to the Bambalapitiya railway station and the stretch from Vivekananda Road to Wasala Road are adorned with street lamps which do not shed light. Even in the middle stretch, the light shed is dim and hazy. Kudos to the Dehiwela MMC under whose purview the stretch from Wasala Road to the Dehiwela railway station falls for switching on the street lights. It is safe for motorists and a pleasure to drive when darkness reigns. (M. Fernando)

title: Two battery swapping stations for electric two-wheelers – USAID
author: Author not found
Content: The United States Agency for International Development (USAID) Sri Lanka Energy Programme and Sling Mobility (Pvt.) Ltd. signed a grant agreement on 18 April to develop and operate two battery swap stations for electric two-wheelers. This grant, the first of its kind for the programme, will fund the construction of the stations, also known as battery switching stations, in Colombo. The stations allow E-vehicle owners to quickly exchange empty batteries for fully charged ones and avoid the waiting time for charging. The project also will recruit 20 new riders to pilot the deployment of E-bikes for delivery services in a timely, cost-saving, and environmentally safer manner. This one grant activity, within a larger group of grants, will assist in catalysing the development of EV charging stations in the country. “The United States and the American people are proud of our enduring and robust 75-year partnership with the people of Sri Lanka,” said USAID Mission Director Gabriel Grau. “We remain fully committed to supporting locally-led initiatives to advance E-technologies that are critical to promoting the progress of a nation in an environmentally friendly and cost-effective way.” “Sling Mobility is a technology solutions company focused on electric vehicles, and its demand-driven approach is key to the future of EVs in Sri Lanka and beyond,” said Love Yadav, general partner for Sling Mobility. “Its business model is stitched around improving EV affordability and faster adoption, reducing rider downtime, and building a platform for sustainable charging. The USAID grant is an important validation for Sling Mobility’s operating model, and we are extremely happy to be a part of this journey.” The results of the pilot programme will show the energy project and Sling Mobility the feasibility of promoting E-battery swapping stations in the country.

title: Parcel with petrol bomb material found in Nanu Oya
author: Author not found
Content: Nanu Oya Police found a parcel consisting of petrol bomb making material from a location close to Glassaugh Upper Division Estate, early yesterday (19). Following a tip-off, Nanu Oya Police and a team of officers rushed to the scene and found the parcel near a secluded house in the estate. When the parcel was examined, Police found bottles filled with petrol, wires, triangle fireworks and some other material being used to produce petrol bombs. Police said the parcel had been abandoned in the location for the past four days. Nanu Oya Police are conducting further inquiries in this connection. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Plant ‘food crops’ at auspicious time
author: Author not found
Content: The Ministry of Agriculture requests all citizens to plant a perennial crop that will bear fruit, during the auspicious planting time which is scheduled today at 6:38 a.m. to celebrate the ritual of planting a sapling this year, under the theme ‘Let’s plant a tree that bears fruit.’  The main event will be held under the patronage of Minister of Agriculture Mahinda Amaraweera at Agunukolapelessa Govi Jana Seva Centre. Meanwhile, Amaraweera has instructed all Departments, Corporations, Authorities and Boards including regional offices belonging to the Ministry of Agriculture to carry out the ritual of planting saplings. Further, the Minister requested all government institutions and private institutions to plant a perennial crop that will lead to food production and will ensure the prosperity of the country. If they are unable to plant a sapling during the auspicious time, the Minister urged the public to do so at a convenient time tomorrow and contribute to this national tree-planting initiative. By Dinithi Wijesundara

title: Two PCs arrested for ‘treasure hunting’
author: Author not found
Content: Wanathawilluwa Police arrested two Constables serving at a STF Camp in Wanathawilluwa on charges of carrying out excavation work linked to treasure hunting on a plot of land where the camp is situated. The Police said, the arrests were made at dawn on 19 April, while the STF Camp is located at Laktowatta, Eighth Mile Post, Wanathawilluwa, Puttalam. They added that ringleader of the 2019 Easter Sunday Attacks, Zahran Hashim had worked as a security guard at Laktowatta for some time. The Police found a cache of explosives in Laktowatta four years ago, after which the STF Camp was set up. Acting on a tip-off received by the Kurunegala STF Camp, Police raided the camp and arrested the two suspects. Wanathawilluwa Police are conducting investigations. By Jude Samantha

title: Incomplete underpass turns into dengue breeding ground
author: Author not found
Content: An incomplete construction site in Kurunegala has turned into dengue mosquito breeding site . An underpass built to safeguard students attending Maliyadeva College, Kurunegala has turned  into a mosquito breeding ground. According to PHIs, the public in the Kurunegala District have been told to  clean their environments and get rid of dengue breeding grounds, but it has been to no avail as the case in point in the location sighted near the school. The construction of the underpass had commenced under the Ministry of Highways on 13 August 2020. Though the construction had been scheduled to be completed within a six-month period it  is still incomplete for the past three-years and in the process it has turned into a dengue mosquito breeding ground. BY Ravindu Sooriyabandara – Kurunegala

title: Applications open for ‘Wasath Siriya 2023’ contests
author: Author not found
Content: The Presidential Secretariat and Ministries have commenced accepting applications for the ‘Wasath Siriya 2023’ Sinhala and Tamil New Year contests. All applications are available on the official website www.pmd.gov.lk To enter the ‘Wasath Siriya’ Avurudu Prince/Princess (Open category) competition, applicants must submit a recent colour photograph taken within the last three months. Eligible applicants should be unmarried and aged between 20 and 35 years. The completed application should be forwarded to [email protected] prior to 3.00 p.m. on 20 April. Valuable gold ornaments will be awarded for first, second and third place winners. The final decision regarding the conditions for the competition rests with the organising committee and more information can be obtained by contacting A.G.M. Isanka (Coordinator) on 0702025095. Those who are applying for ‘Wasath Siriya’ marathon, you must include a medical report to confirm that they are physically fit to run a race of over 20 km. All applications must be submitted to the Security Division of the President’s Office before 12.00 p.m. on 21 which could also be forwarded through the e-mail address [email protected] or through the WhatsApp number 0710573828. In addition, a standard cycling competition for both men and women is open to all residents of the island, and it is being jointly organised by the Sri Lanka Air Force and the Sri Lanka Cycling Federation. The men’s standard cycling race will be held along the Galle Face Road through Negombo Road, Ja-Ela, Katunayake, Minuwangoda, Wayangoda, Nittambuwa, Kandy Road, Kadawatha and Peliyagoda, culminating at the Galle Face Road. The women’s standard cycling race will take place along the Galle Road, Galle Face Road, and travel through Pamankada, Piliyandala, Kesbewa, Kottawa, Maharagama, Nugegoda, Tunmulla Junction, Pittala Handiya and Lake House, culminating at the Galle Face Road. Male and female cyclists born between 1973 and 2004 are eligible to compete in the event. However, standard bikes equipped with 48 and 18 front and rear cogs, as well as handlebar rest bars/hack bars, are not allowed to enter the competition. Accordingly, the contestants interested in participating in this event should complete the relevant application forms and get it validated by a government authorised doctor regarding their health condition and send it to the organising committee via the e-mail address [email protected] or via the WhatsApp number 0788429688. Applications received after 10 a.m. on 21 April 2023 will be rejected, and the selected applicants will be notified by Whatsapp message. There is no application or registration cost.

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Cabinet greenlights obtaining Parliament approval
author: Author not found
Content: The Cabinet has approved a proposal by President Ranil Wickremesinghe, as the Finance Minister, to obtain the approval of Parliament for the International Monetary Fund’s (IMF) Extended Fund Facility (EFF). This was revealed by Cabinet Spokesman Bandula Gunawardena during the Cabinet media briefing yesterday (18). The IMF Extended Fund Facility and other relevant documents were tabled in Parliament on 22 March 2023. It is required to obtain the stance of the MPs regarding the IMF Extended Fund Facility and Parliamentary approval is also required to draft laws to implement the main policies in connection with the IMF Extended Fund Facility.

title: Semi-luxury bus service to cease from May end
author: Author not found
Content: The National Transport Commission (NTC) has declared that the semi-luxury bus service in Sri Lanka will cease operations from the end of May 2023. Chairman of the NTC Nilan Miranda, indicated that the decision was taken after numerous complaints were received about the semi-luxury bus service. The NTC Chairman further said of the 430 semi-luxury buses now in operation, the owners of 20 have requested transformation, and the process is ongoing. He also said all bus owners who want to convert their semi-luxury buses to general service or luxury service have been instructed to do so by 31 May 2023. It was said in a performance report (PER/SLB/2017/01), prepared by the National Audit Office that the standards needed to exist in the semi-luxury bus service were not at an expected level, the effectiveness of supervisory functions conducted by the NTC in that connection were insufficient and permit holders, conductors and drivers had less awareness of on the rules, regulations and qualities to continue in the service. The report further said the commuters would be inconvenienced as the people could not easily identify the bus whether it is a semi-luxury bus by the destination board used in the buses and as buses are not operated in accordance with a unified timetable. By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan

title: New Electricity Bill to Parliament end May – Kanchana
author: Author not found
Content: Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said yesterday (18) that the new Electricity Bill will be presented to Parliament by the end of May. In a tweet, Wijesekera said Cabinet approval was granted on Monday (17) for the proposed road map and timeline of the CEB restructuring process. “Approval was also granted to set up a reform secretariat, obtain the assistance of development agencies such as the ADB, World Bank, USAID and JICA for the process, to conduct a financial and human resource audit and complete the transition process by October 2023,” the minister said. By Methmalie Dissanayake

title: Health Ministry unable to resolve drug shortage – GMOA
author: Author not found
Content: Doctors accused the Health Ministry of being unable to provide a solution to the existing drug shortage and the continuous increase of pharmaceutical prices. Secretary of the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA), Dr. Haritha Aluthge yesterday (18) expressed the GMOA’s strong objection to the Health Ministry for failing to provide sustainable solutions to the drug crisis. “The Health Ministry should act immediately to provide relief to affected people by regulating the prices of drugs and equipment as the National Medicines Regulatory Authority’s (NMRA) Sub Committee on Price Control had reactivated its wrong methodology,” he said. “The medicinal drug shortage has affected patients seeking treatment from national hospitals to peripheral hospital system. The Minister and his officials have made various predictions in front of the media from time to time to no avail as the medicinal drug crisis which has overcome the country’s health system has not yet been steered towards a more encouraging direction,” he charged. It is the absolute responsibility of the Government and the Ministry of Health to confirm the right to life of the people by identifying the challenges and crises faced by the island’s free health service and give them top priority by solving them. The shortage of drugs and the increase in the private sector have been normalised. “Patients and their relatives have fallen from the frying pan into the fire due to the increase in drug prices,” Dr. Aluthge lamented. He added that it was surprising that although with inflation going down due to the stabilisation of the economy bringing down the prices of goods and services, the charges for medicines in private hospitals have not witnessed the same reduction. Lashing out, the GMOA Secretary said private hospitals had increased their charges taking refuge in the economic crisis. “People have complained of exploitation by those institutions on various occasions. Therefore, it is necessary to provide relief to the patients and the public by taking necessary legal and practical measures to regulate the charges of private hospitals,” he said. By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: No talks between SL, China over exportof Toque monkeys– Bandula
author: Author not found
Content: Cabinet Spokesman Bandula Gunawardena said yesterday (18) that there has been no discussion between China and Sri Lanka in connection with sending toque monkeys to China. Addressing the Cabinet media briefing yesterday (18), Gunawardena said a private company in China has contacted the Minister of Agriculture about the possibility of sending toque monkeys to zoos in China. The response of the minister to this proposal is being circulated on media, Gunawardena said. “An expert committee will be formed to study this proposal with the participation of all the stakeholders. There are certain laws that need to be followed when sending animals to other countries, even for export as meat. Chinese laws with regard to this subject are tougher than ours,” he said, responding a question raised by a journalist. BY Methmalie Dissanayake

title: All nine Thaldena Prison escapees rounded up
author: Author not found
Content: All nine inmates who had escaped from the Thaldena Open Prison Rehabilitation Centre in Badulla have been arrested, the Prisons Department said. The inmates had fled the Rehabilitation Centre in the early hours of 17 April to Kandaketiya. Springing into action, officers of the Rehabilitation Centre managed to capture two escapees near the farm belonging to the facility. In a search operation with the assistance of area residents, four others were arrested near a paddy field in Baduluoya, Kandaketiya at around 6:30 p.m. on 17 April. Meanwhile, the remaining three were captured at around 4:00 a.m. yesterday (18) near Kiriwehera, Kandaketiya. The escapees, aged 23-26, had been referred to the Rehabilitation Centre in connection with drug peddling charges. They were due to be released within two to three months, after completing rehabilitation. By Jayalath Dissanayake – Badulla

title: TNA to leadhartal againstAnti-Terrorism Bill
author: Author not found
Content: The Tamil National Alliance (TNA) and several other organisations have organised a full scale hartal in the North and East on 25 April to protest against the tabling of the proposed Anti-Terrorism Bill in Parliament. A spokesperson of the main student body of the University of Jaffna said the hartal will be staged in order to protest at the move made by the Government to adopt the Anti-Terrorism Bill in Parliament, the decision to arbitrarily hand over rights of lands in the North-East to certain parties with vested interests, the failure to resolve issues pertaining to religious places in the North and East, the forced takeover of lands owned by Tamils in the North under the pretext of archaeological importance etc. The organisers behind the staging of the Hartal have urged the public in the North and East to shutdown trade stalls from morning to dusk and to refrain from using passenger transport. Sources revealed that if the Anti-Terrorism Bill is tabled in Parliament on the said date, the MPs of TNA have planned to stage a protest in the House as well. BY Rasadi Gamage – Vavuniya

title: Hitler’s strategies employed to suppress Opposition – Sajith
author: Author not found
Content: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa alleged that the Government follows Adolf Hitler’s strategies to suppress the Opposition. Premadasa claimed yesterday (18) that the President is engaging in a cunning strategy of spreading false propaganda, just as Hitler used Joseph Goebbels and spread lies through the media during World War II. He alleged that a mass campaign of turning truth into lies and turning lies into truth is being carried out by a group of people calling themselves ‘journalists’ who are an insult to real journalists in the country. Premadasa said the Government is fabricating news that the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) had negotiated to get the PM post. “The SJB will never join the Government which has been rejected by the people,” he stressed. By Nabiya Vaffoor

title: Eggs should be sold by weight – AIPA
author: Author not found
Content: The All Island Poultry Association (AIPA) said the Trade Ministry and the Agriculture Ministry should agree to determine the price of eggs by weight. AIPA President Ajith Gunasekara said such a decision will be a huge relief to consumers. “If 1 kg of eggs is sold at Rs 850, it is acceptable according to the imposed control price. 1 kg of eggs would consist of at least 16 to 20 eggs weighing around 50g each,” he said. He listed the problems caused by imposing the maximum retail price introduced in August 2022. “We should adhere to the latest technology and international standards and introduce value-added products to the market. Eggs weighing both 35g and 70g are sold at a retail price of Rs 44. Consumers are inconvenienced as a result,” Gunasekara said. He further said the bakery industry already purchases eggs by weight, which also determines the prices of their products. By Nabiya Vaffoor

title: Dilapidated bridge a death trap
author: Author not found
Content: Former member of the Imbuldeniya Pradeshiya Sabha (PS) Indika Jayamanna said that the bridge built at the Pabahinna, Rajawatta Road, in Mutthettuwegama, Balangoda, which starts near the Sabaragamuwa University, is now dilapidated. He said that the bridge is utilised 24/7 by motorists as well as by SLTB and private busses. Jayamanna noted that scores of pilgrims and devotees also tend to use the bridge on weekends, Poya Days and mercantile holidays to visit the Kuragala Sacred Site and Temple. According to the former Imbuldeniya PS member, even visitors to the Samanalawewa Reservoir also use the said road and bridge but warned that if it is not renovated soon it could lead to serious accidents. Hence, he urged the Government to look into the matter and address it before lives are lost. BY S. Weerawansa – Kalthota

title: Brother dies saving sister’s life at US birthday party shooting
author: Author not found
Content: The birthday girl at an Alabama party where four people were shot dead was saved by her brother, she has told the BBC. He later died in her arms. Alexis Dowdell was celebrating her 16th birthday at a dance studio in rural Dadeville when her 18-year-old brother Phil Dowdell came to get her after hearing that someone at the party had a gun. Her mother, LaTonya Allen, had also heard the rumours. She said that she turned on the lights, went to the DJ booth, and asked whoever had a firearm to leave the party. But when no-one spoke up, she turned the lights back off. The gunfire erupted shortly after. “All of a sudden you hear gunshots and you just see everybody running towards the door and people falling and screaming,” Alexis told the BBC. Her brother Phil pushed her to the ground, she said, before the two became separated in the chaos. She was able to escape the venue and took cover outside before someone came to help her up. Alexis said she hid behind another building in case the attacker was still on the loose. When she eventually went back inside, she discovered that her brother had been shot. He had lost a lot of blood. She stayed with him as he drifted in and out of consciousness. He was unable to talk, though he opened his eyes and raised his eyebrows as she cradled him in her arms. “The last thing I told him was to stay strong,” she said. She added that her birthday would never be the same. Thirty-two others were injured in Saturday night’s attack at the party in Dadeville, a small, close-knit town of roughly 3,000. Police have yet to name a suspect or a motive and have urged the public to come forward with information. Alexis and her mother said they did not know what had led to the shooting. The city’s local pastor told the BBC the gunman was still at large. Jimmy Frank Goodman Sr, the mayor of Dadeville, told the BBC that the scene at the hospital after the shooting was chaotic, even worse than what he had witnessed during his time serving in the Vietnam War. “There were people crying, bodies going into the emergency room and bloody clothes on the ground,” he said. (BBC)

title: Mullaitivu man dies from snake bite
author: Author not found
Content: An individual in Mankulam, Mullaitivu died from a snake bite on 17 April. According to Police, the 47-year-old victim, Balasunderam Jegatheeswaran, had noticed a snake on the road while on his way home from a reception. He then attacked the snake with a pole that he found nearby. The victim was inebriated at the time. Believing the animal was dead, he carried it on his shoulder at which time the serpent fatally stung the victim. A group of youths found the victim lying on the road and rushed him to the Mankulam Hospital after which he had been transferred to the Kilinochchi Hospital where he passed away. By Rasadi Chathurangi Gamage – Vavuniya

title: Chemical contamination likely – Wijewardena
author: Author not found
Content: The reason behind the recent deaths of fish since Sunday (16), in the Kotmale Oya, which flows from Ambewela to Talawakelle could be the waters of the Oya being contaminated with a chemical substance, Nuwara Eliya District Health Services Director Nissanka Wijewardena said. The waters of the Kotmale Oya flow across a 40 km stretch from Ambewela to Meraya and from Algin up to Agarakanda through Lindula and Talawakelle. However, the fish of the Kotmale Oya had begun to die on a 12 km stretch from 16 April. The authorities had then advised residents and villagers not to consume the dead fish till the reason behind the mysterious deaths is revealed. Lindula Medical Officer of Health (MOH) Dr. Rishi Thurairaja said samples of dead fish and water samples from the Kotmale Oya were sent for testing. By Neeta Pathma Kumari – Norwood

title: Hakeem wants Wakf Act amended
author: Author not found
Content: Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) Leader MP Rauff Hakeem said that the Wakf Act must be amended to provide better service to the needy. Hakeem said that officials in charge of Wakf property must act with responsibility, in the maintenance and protection of the property. He also claimed that misusing and destroying Wakf property, donated by the philanthropists from the Muslim community for spiritual purposes without proper management is a matter of concern. He said that therefore, amendments must be made to the Wakf Act to ensure that those properties are be used for the purposes for which they have been donated. Hakeem raised these concerns during an ifthar organised by the Metropolitan College at Sainthamaruthu recently. There are many instances where Wakf properties are being misused and destroyed due to miss-management, Hakeem said. “The issues pertaining to the Wakf properties of Maharagama Gafoorriyah Arabic College and its property in Grand Pass Road, in Colombo 14, are best examples of this,” Hakeem added. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Future of SOC on Religious Affairs, Co-Existence discussed
author: Author not found
Content: A discussion pertaining to the future affairs of the Sectoral Oversight Committee (SOC), on Religious Affairs and Co-Existence, was held at the Committee meeting, held under the Chairmanship of MP Upul Mahendra Rajapaksha recently. Identifying the role, scope, future programme and problems of the institutions under the Ministry of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs was taken into discussion at the Committee meeting. The Secretary to the Ministry of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs, Somaratne Vidanapathirana and other officials expressed views at the meeting. It was also disclosed that arrangements have been made to hold this year’s National Vesak festival in Puttalam District as a joint programme with the support of all religions. Attention was paid to the upcoming programmes and matters pertaining to the Department of Buddhist Affairs, Department of Muslim Religious and Cultural Affairs, Department of Hindu Religious and Cultural Affairs, and Department of Christian Religious Affairs. There was also a discussion about the strengthening of the law necessary for the purpose of solving the problems related to all religions, preventing the existing cultural decline. The Chair of the Committee said that the Sectoral Oversight Committee supports the activities necessary to solve the problems and strengthen the ministerial programme and if necessary, the minister is also expected to be involved in the committee. Accordingly, it was decided to prepare a basic programme on the issues that the committee is expected to focus on and to work in the future.

title: Lucrative foreign jobs for skilled workers
author: Author not found
Content: Labour and Foreign Employment Minister Manusha Nanayakkara said his Ministry has been able to secure lucrative employment opportunities in several countries for skilled workers including caregiver jobs in Japan and Europe, hospitality industry jobs in England, Canada, and Australia and Construction industry jobs in the Middle East. But the Minister lamented it has been difficult to find workers with the necessary skills to meet this job demand. The Minister said, to secure these job opportunities, the necessary skilled workers should be trained, and that an agreement will be signed with the Vocational Training Authority to provide vocational training for youth aimed at foreign employment. The Minister was speaking on the occasion of signing a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment and the Vocational Training Authority yesterday morning (18) to provide vocational training for youth aimed at foreign employment. Under the SLBFE Act, which functions under the Ministry of Labour and Foreign Employment, there is an opportunity to train workers targeting foreign jobs. But training is not our main task. The main task of this institution is to regulate the field of foreign employment, Nanayakkara said. “Also, the welfare of expatriate workers and their family members becomes a major responsibility of this institution. The primary responsibility for training workers for employment is assigned to the Ministry of Education and to the Ministry of Vocational Training. So we took a decision to leave such matters in the hands of the vocational training institutes in the public sector and the private vocational training institutes recognised by the Government,” he added. “It will be implemented as a policy decision. We are paying more attention to the welfare and protection of expatriate workers and their families.” Acting Chairman of SLBFE, Saminda Jayasekara and Chairman of Sri Lanka Vocational Training Authority, Air Vice Marshal (Retd) Prasanna Ranasinghe signed the agreement on behalf of their respective institutions. Minister of Education Susil Premajayantha and State Minister of Foreign Employment Promotion Jagath Pushpakumara were also present on this occasion. According to SLBFE, there are caregiver jobs in Japan and Europe, Hospitality industry jobs in England, Canada, and Australia, and Construction industry jobs in the Middle East. Also, an agreement for a vocational training programme aimed at foreign employment is in the pipeline.

title: Pera Uni Alumni Association Colombo Chapter AGM
author: Author not found
Content: The 32nd Annual General Meeting (AGM) of the Alumni Association of the University of Peradeniya-Colombo Chapter (AAUPCC) was held on 31 March, at the Institute of Engineers Sri Lanka, Colombo 7. Balasingham, Neliya Fernando and Nimal Gunawardena, Coordinator: W.M.H.C. Weerasinghe, Auditor: S.C. Mayadunne, and 29 members were also elected as members of the Management Council.

title: Inaugural University of Colombo Alumni Pinnacle Awards and Alumni Night 2023
author: Author not found
Content: The Inaugural University of Colombo Alumni Pinnacle Awards and Alumni Night 2023 hosted by the Alumni Association of the University of Colombo will be held on 12 Friday May 2023 from 7 p.m. at the Grand Ballroom of the Galadari Hotel, Colombo. Formed in 1982, the Alumni Association of the University of Colombo is an apex body of the alumni of various faculties of the University, forming a link between its membership and the University. The Association was formed by the University of Colombo during the tenure of the late Prof. Stanley Wijesundera, Vice Chancellor with Deshamanya Tissa Devendra as the founder President of the Association. The Association has several key objectives including Student Welfare, Student Development, Member Engagement and Fellowship. The Members of the Association as Thought Leaders of the Country have played many roles at strategic and policy levels. After having completed 40 plus years the Association is launching its Inaugural Alumni Pinnacle Awards to recognise a select group of Alumni of the University of Colombo who have immensely contributed to the Country, Society and the University of Colombo which will be followed by the Alumni Night 2023, an evening of Music, Dance and rekindling of Memories at the University of Colombo. This event is open to all Alumni of the University of Colombo and their guests. The Corporate Partners of the Association are Akbar Brothers and LOLC Group. Entrance Tickets priced at Rs. 3,500/- can be reserved on a First Come First Served Basis by calling Ayeshah on 0777208372 or Delanie on 077 3868159 or Visiting the Alumni Association Office at College House between 9:30 AM and 2:30 PM on any weekday.

title: CEB moves 30 dieselgeneratorsto Hambantota GSS
author: Author not found
Content: Supplying electricity to the entire country around the clock is one of the main objectives of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB). In managing the electricity supply to the entire country with given resources, one of the major challenges faced by CEB is to supply electricity around the clock to the southern part of the island in the dry season, owing to the lack of generation in the Southern region and constraints in the transmission network.  CEB experienced this issue in yesteryears and the remedies adopted were acquiring supplementary power for the Southern region and expediting the construction of new transmission lines. In 2023, the same issue cropped up again and while action was taken to acquire supplementary power and since it takes a considerable period of time to complete a competitive tender process to procure supplementary power, the Power and Energy Minister together with the CEB top management headed by the CEB General Manager decided on 21 April to make use of CEB-owned 1 MW x 30 Nos diesel generators installed at Kolonnawa and Thulhiriya GSS by shifting them to the Southern part of the island to address the power supply challenges faced in the South. The technical feasibility dictated the most suitable location for these 30 generators of 30 MW capacity is Hambantota Grid Substation, enabling it to operate all 30 generators at one location. The decision to shift the 30 generators to Hambantota Grid Substation has been implemented and ultimately, it materialised on 31 March. All work from planning to commissioning was done by CEB staff within a short time span of 33 days demonstrating excellent professionalism, from the top engineers to field technical employees. All worked together to carry out this assignment. Vigilant leadership, exemplary delegation, dedicated supervision and professional execution are important traits CEB staff exhibited during this exercise under the leadership of the CEB General Manager. This is a golden example, where CEB demonstrated its capability and capacity successfully on challenging engineering executions.

title: SJB demands probe into rumour on Kfir
author: Author not found
Content: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) demanded an immediate investigation into a rumour that an agreement had been signed with Israel for a USD 55 million contract to repair several Kfir aircraft in the possession of the Sri Lanka Air Force. Addressing the media on Monday (17) SJB MP Tissa Attanayake demanded an investigation, by the Ministry of Defence, to determine the accuracy of the rumour. “The forex crisis is still there in our country. The only thing people feel that the situation is under control is because we are not paying our debts. Despite the dollar crisis, there is a rumour that Israel has signed a USD 55 million contract to repair several Kfir aircraft in the possession of the Sri Lanka Air Force. If this is true, it is unnecessary move at a critical juncture like this. The priority should not be the allocating of USD 55 million to repair Kfir aircraft, when there are serious issues such as food and medicine shortages in the country,” he said. He added that the Government should immediately look into these rumours and act accordingly. By Nabiya Vaffoor

title: 39-year-old murdered in Endana
author: Author not found
Content: A 39-year-old was murdered in Endana on Monday (17). According to Police, the suspect had attacked the victim with a blunt weapon following a dispute between the duo. The victim is a resident of Kahawatta. The suspect was arrested and produced before the Pelmadulla Magistrate yesterday (18) and remanded till 25 April. Endana Police are conducting investigations. By Dinithi Wijesundara

title: New Year celebrated on grand scale – Rangebandara
author: Author not found
Content: UNP General Secretary Palitha Rangebandara claimed on Monday (17) that after the protracted Covid-19 lockdowns and the economic crisis, Sri Lankans celebrated the Sinhala & Tamil New Year on a grand scale this year. Rangebandara said that due to Covid-19 pandemic and political instability it was not possible to celebrate the New Year in the past. Addressing the media at Sirikotha Rangebandara said due to the proper management and a leadership, the country’s situation has totally changed today and President Ranil Wickremesinghe has been able to bring the bankrupt economy of this country to a positive direction fixing every issue one by one. “The President has initiated necessary steps to free the people of this country fronm debt and set the country on the path of development. Everyone, from University students, trade unionists, students and those who hold responsible positions in the society must give their support to the President,” Rangebandara said. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: SriLankan forced to ground five aircraft
author: Author not found
Content: SriLankan Airlines has been forced to ground five of its aircraft for several months due to the lack of engines and spare parts, Ceylon Today reliably learns. The state-of-the-art Airbus A320neo and A321neo aircraft joined the national carrier post-2017. The A320neo can carry 150 passengers while the A321neo can accommodate 188 passengers. The registrations of these aircraft are 4R-ANA, 4R-ANB, 4R-AND, 4R-ANE, and 4R-ANF.  Chairman of SriLankan Airlines Independent Workers’ Union Janaka Wijayapathirathna told the media that the root cause of this issue is operating six different aircraft types, which makes sourcing spares a nightmare. “If the airline followed a proper business plan, it won’t have to face such an unfortunate situation. Even major players like Emirates operate only two to three aircraft types,” he said. Wijayapathirathna added that the national airline is facing huge losses as a result of grounding aircraft. “We are compelled to cut back on profitable flights due to a shortage of aircraft. Compounding the issue, the lease payment on these grounded aircraft amounts to USD 350,000 to USD 400,000.” The union leader urged the Government to draw up a proper business plan for the national carrier to save it from rack and ruin. “There is an ongoing debate about privatising the airline, but if this situation continues there won’t be an airline left to privatise,” he stressed. By Adnan Ali Cassim

title: UL 605 lands at BIA after lengthy delay
author: Author not found
Content: UL 605, flying from Melbourne to Colombo, landed at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) at 7:38 a.m. yesterday (17), after being grounded for nearly 30 hours. According to Flightradar24, the aircraft departed Melbourne Airport at 2:00 a.m. (GMT+10) as UL 605D. The Airbus A330-300, registration 4R-ALM, carrying 300 passengers, which was scheduled to depart Melbourne Airport on 15 April afternoon, was rescheduled for 4:30 p.m. on 16 April. However, it was delayed once again. SriLankan Airlines Spokesman, Deepal Perera, told the media that a team of six engineers left for Melbourne on 15 April night to rectify the aircraft’s technical issue and released it to service following a thorough inspection. “UL 605 was delayed due to technical reasons. We managed to reroute some of the passengers who needed to travel to Colombo urgently and provided accommodation to stranded customers. SriLankan Airlines regrets any inconvenience caused by the delay,” he said. By Adnan Ali Cassim
